item.title: Compile Podcast Ep 15: Adaptability: an overlooked virtue
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Nick Wu", "picture"=>{"path"=>"/assets/image/me.jpg"}, "social"=>{"twitter"=>"WujunaoNick", "github"=>"NickWu007", "email"=>"mailto:wujunao19950715@gmail.com"}}
item.description: This week I talk about adaptability as a software engineer, from a blog post that I wrote earlier this week!
item.content:encoded:
This week I talk about adaptability as a software engineer, from a blog post that I wrote earlier this week!

Breakpoints

  • 00:50 Topic intro: adaptability as a software engineer
  • 01:33 How did I come across this?
  • 03:27 “Sure, but why do I have to be adaptable?”
  • 05:18 Adaptability as software engineers
  • 07:37 “Great! So how do I become more adaptable?”
  • 10:20 Closing words

Links in this episode:

  • Quote from the Big Bang Theory: https://www.quotes.net/mquote/884693
  • Interesting post about taking feedback in code reviews: https://dev.to/demianbrecht/dude-i-m-slagging-your-code-not-you-4nja
  • Quote from Albert Einstein: https://www.goodreads.com/quotes/85475-the-measure-of-intelligence-is-the-ability-to-change
  • Quote from Adam Hunt in The Pragmatic Programmer: From Journeyman to Master: https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/4099.The_Pragmatic_Programmer

Reach out to us!

Subscribe and stay tuned! Also send in any comment or request for new topics and we will try our best to make them happen!

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/WujunaoNick

This Podcast is also on:

  • Google Play Music
  • iTunes
  • Spotify

item.title: Compile Podcast Ep 12: How to avoid quarantine gut?
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Nick Wu", "picture"=>{"path"=>"/assets/image/me.jpg"}, "social"=>{"twitter"=>"WujunaoNick", "github"=>"NickWu007", "email"=>"mailto:wujunao19950715@gmail.com"}}
item.description: This week my friend Yuekun and I talk more about maintaining a healthy diet during the quarantine, and how to avoid getting a quarantine gut!
item.content:encoded:
This week my friend Yuekun and I talk more about maintaining a healthy diet during the quarantine, and how to avoid getting a quarantine gut!

Breakpoints

  • 00:32 Chill zone and catching up
  • 07:26 Topic intro: how to avoid quarantine gut
  • 12:50 A balanced diet
  • 16:50 “Eat your vegetables”
  • 19:30 Yuekun recommends a few staple vegetables
  • 38:38 How to correctly limit total caloric intake
  • 44:45 Enjoy your food
  • 47:41 Counting calories work, but don’t count on it
  • 53:46 Consider using supplements
  • 57:58 Wrapping up

Links in this episode:

  • Great video from Vietnam about Covid-19
  • Yuekun’s Instagram

Reach out to us!

Subscribe and stay tuned! Also send in any comment or request for new topics and we will try our best to make them happen!

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/WujunaoNick

This Podcast is also on:

  • Google Play Music
  • iTunes
  • Spotify

item.title: Compile Podcast Ep 11: Can WFH be productive?
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Nick Wu", "picture"=>{"path"=>"/assets/image/me.jpg"}, "social"=>{"twitter"=>"WujunaoNick", "github"=>"NickWu007", "email"=>"mailto:wujunao19950715@gmail.com"}}
item.description: This week my good friend John joins me again to talk about how to be productive while Working from home during the times of quarantine!
item.content:encoded:
This week my good friend John joins me again to talk about how to be productive while Working from home during the times of quarantine!

Breakpoints

  • 00:42 Chill zone and catching up
  • 02:45 Topic intro: productivity while working from home
  • 03:20 Our WFH experiences
  • 10:35 Establish a clean cut between work and life
    • 16:08 Having a dedicated work area
    • 19:40 Get some fresh air/change of scenery
  • 23:05 Keep your work routine
  • 25:35 Take a breather before starting work
  • 28:58 Our typical work day during the quarantine
  • 35:00 Get your remote toolkit ready
  • 44:15 Be social and avoid loniness
  • 46:34 Distractions and how to moderate them
  • 54:09 “Compile” time

Reach out to us!

Subscribe and stay tuned! Also send in any comment or request for new topics and we will try our best to make them happen!

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/WujunaoNick

This Podcast is also on:

  • Google Play Music
  • iTunes
  • Spotify

item.title: Compile Podcast Ep 10: Staying fit at home
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Nick Wu", "picture"=>{"path"=>"/assets/image/me.jpg"}, "social"=>{"twitter"=>"WujunaoNick", "github"=>"NickWu007", "email"=>"mailto:wujunao19950715@gmail.com"}}
item.description: This week my friend Yuekun and I talk more about fitness at home and how you can avoid "isolation gut"!
item.content:encoded:
This week my friend Yuekun and I talk more about fitness at home and how you can avoid “isolation gut”!

Breakpoints

  • 01:00 Chill zone and catching up
  • 05:00 Topic intro: staying fit at home
  • 07:20 Why staying fit is so important, especially now
    • 08:25 A Strong immune system
    • 11:40 Nick’s experience with momentum and inertia
    • 16:17 Lack of activity leads to general health problems
  • 26:42 Yuekun’s very own exercise routines
    • 29:41 Stretches
    • 37:20 How to get a good stretch?
    • 39:00 Slow steady cardio
    • 42:21 Basic and intermediate workouts
    • 45:00 Results with the routines for Yuekun’s parents
  • 49:19 Nick and Yuekun share their current routines
  • 56:43 Wrapping up

Links in this episode:

  • Great video that explains Coronavirus
  • Home exercise routines designed by Yuekun himself
  • Yuekun’s Instagram

Reach out to us!

Subscribe and stay tuned! Also send in any comment or request for new topics and we will try our best to make them happen!

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/WujunaoNick

This Podcast is also on:

  • Google Play Music
  • iTunes
  • Spotify

item.title: Compile Podcast Ep 9: Workout and Productivity
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Nick Wu", "picture"=>{"path"=>"/assets/image/me.jpg"}, "social"=>{"twitter"=>"WujunaoNick", "github"=>"NickWu007", "email"=>"mailto:wujunao19950715@gmail.com"}}
item.description: This week my friend Yuekun and I talk about working out and how it impacts your productivity!
item.content:encoded:
This week my friend Yuekun and I talk about working out and how it impacts your productivity!

Breakpoints

  • 00:00 A little foreword
  • 01:00 Podcast Intro
  • 02:25 What happens when you don’t work out
    • 02:54 Prone to chronical injuries
    • 04:03 Mental stress from getting stuck at work
    • 05:16 Lack of discipline and confidence
  • 07:25 “Does working out make you more tired actually?”
  • 09:19 Benefits to productivity from working out
    • 09:53 It is important to spend some time away from work
    • 10:08 Science of health benefits
    • 11:37 Nick’s personal journey of working out
    • 13:29 Benefits to developers
    • 18:32 Discovering hidden points
    • 21:35 Cultivate a healthy respect to time management and building habits
  • 27:54 What time of day would be the best for workout if you have live a 9-5 life?
  • 37:56 Wrapping up

Reach out to us!

Subscribe and stay tuned! Also send in any comment or request for new topics and we will try our best to make them happen!

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/WujunaoNick

This Podcast is also on:

  • Google Play Music
  • iTunes
  • Spotify

item.title: Compile Podcast Ep 8: Anxiety -- How to deal with it?
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Nick Wu", "picture"=>{"path"=>"/assets/image/me.jpg"}, "social"=>{"twitter"=>"WujunaoNick", "github"=>"NickWu007", "email"=>"mailto:wujunao19950715@gmail.com"}}
item.description: Jasper and I talk about our experiences with anxiety, and tips about dealing with it mentally and practically!
item.content:encoded:
In this week’s episode Jasper and I talk about our experiences with anxiety, and tips about dealing with it mentally and practically!

Breakpoints

  • 00:25 Chill zone
  • 07:20 Mindset towards stress and anxiety
    • 08:55 “Everyone has it”
    • 11:35 Acknowledge your anxiety
    • 14:44 Find out the root of stress
    • 21:30 “It’s not the end of the world”
    • 23:00 “Don’t suffer twice”
    • 24:25 “You will not remember what you were worried about last week”
  • 28:40 Practical tips to deal with anxiety
    • 28:58 Breathing exercise
    • 33:40 Find distraction and keep busy
    • 38:05 Talk about your anxiety
    • 41:15 Don’t be afraid to seek help
    • 42:25 “Running away is shameful, but useful” (use with caution)
  • 45:45 “Compile” time
  • 46:34 Personal favourite

Links in this episode:

  • “The art of breathing” by Dr Danny Penman: amazon
  • “The Internship” movie
  • Hungarian proverb: “Running away is shameful, but useful”

Reach out to us!

Subscribe and stay tuned! Also send in any comment or request for new topics and we will try our best to make them happen!

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/WujunaoNick

This Podcast is also on:

  • Google Play Music
  • iTunes
  • Spotify

item.description: Jasper and I talk about our hobbies when we are not coding, and what you can do to find a hobby for yourself!
item.content:encoded:
In this week’s episode Jasper and I talk about our hobbies when we are not coding, and what you can do to find a hobby for yourself!

Breakpoints

  • 00:58 Why is a hobby important, espeically for a developer
  • 11:27 How do I go about finding a hobby?
  • 21:17 Jasper and I talk about our hobbies
    • 21:25 Technical hobbies
    • 28:15 Non-technical hobbies
  • 42:40 Wrap up

Links in this episode:

  • Developer forum that I follow: dev.to
  • “The Phoenix Project”: amazon, audible book
  • Recipe for the Chocolate Lava cake we made for In this week’s episode Jasper and I talk about our hobbies when we are not coding, and what you can do to find a hobby for yourself!

Reach out to us!

Next week we will have a new guest with a new topic! So subscribe and stay tuned! Also send in any comment or request for new topics and we will try our best to make them happen!

item.title: Compile Podcast Ep 6: Developer Health
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Nick Wu", "picture"=>{"path"=>"/assets/image/me.jpg"}, "social"=>{"twitter"=>"WujunaoNick", "github"=>"NickWu007", "email"=>"mailto:wujunao19950715@gmail.com"}}
item.description: In this episode, we talk about Developer Health. We discuss the mindset towards health as developers and give coding and non-coding related tips.
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone! Welcome to the Compile Podcast, a show where 2 programmers talk about anything and everything!

In this episode, we talk about Developer Health. We discuss the mindset towards health as developers and give coding and non-coding related tips.

Next week we will have a new topic to discuss! So subscribe and stay tuned!

My Twitter

This Podcast is also on:

  • Google Play Music
  • iTunes

Links in this episode:

“Why we sleep” book

My recommended audio book

item.title: Compile Podcast Ep 5: Developer Workflow
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Nick Wu", "picture"=>{"path"=>"/assets/image/me.jpg"}, "social"=>{"twitter"=>"WujunaoNick", "github"=>"NickWu007", "email"=>"mailto:wujunao19950715@gmail.com"}}
item.description: In this episode, we talk about Developer Workflow with a great guest. We discuss the differences between uni and industry software projects, with some funny stories and some helpful tips, whether you are working or studying.
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone! Welcome to the Compile Podcast, a show where 2 programmers talk about anything and everything!

In this episode, we talk about Developer Workflow with a great guest. We discuss the differences between uni and industry software projects, with some funny stories and some helpful tips, whether you are working or studying.

Next week we will have a new guest with a new topic! So subscribe and stay tuned!

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/WujunaoNick

This Podcast is also on:

  • Google Play Music: https://play.google.com/music/listen#/ps/Ifd5mlxhgc5cmlsytadsglqfd4y
  • iTunes: https://podcasts.apple.com/gb/podcast/the-compile-podcast/id1436437367

Breakpoints

  • 00:00 Intro.
  • 00:40 Catch up with John.
  • 06:07 Developer Workflow: how we do software projects.
    • 06:42 Uni vs industry project workflow
    • 18:48 Main framework: waterfall + agile
    • 25:04 The main stages of a typical software project
    • 52:04 “Compile down to essentials”.
  • 53:10 Pick and Plug.

Links in this episode:

The Mythical Man-Month: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Mythical_Man-Month\

Waterfall development process: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waterfall_model

Agile development process: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agile_software_development

John and Steve’s podcast “The Discomfortable Zone”: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-discomfortable-zone-podcast/id1294539931?mt=2.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, we talk about Developer Workflow with a great guest. We discuss the differences between uni and industry software projects, with some funny stories and some helpful tips, whether you are working or studying.

This Podcast is also on:

  • Google Play Music: https://play.google.com/music/listen#/ps/Ifd5mlxhgc5cmlsytadsglqfd4y
  • iTunes: https://podcasts.apple.com/gb/podcast/the-compile-podcast/id1436437367

Breakpoints

  • 00:00 Intro.
  • 00:40 Catch up with John.
  • 06:07 Developer Workflow: how we do software projects.
    • 06:42 Uni vs industry project workflow
    • 18:48 Main framework: waterfall + agile
    • 25:04 The main stages of a typical software project
    • 52:04 “Compile down to essentials”.
  • 53:10 Pick and Plug.

Links in this episode:

The Mythical Man-Month: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Mythical_Man-Month\

Waterfall development process: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Waterfall_model

Agile development process: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agile_software_development

John and Steve’s podcast “The Discomfortable Zone”: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-discomfortable-zone-podcast/id1294539931?mt=2.
item.itunes:author: Nick Wu

item.title: Compile Podcast Ep 4: Impostor Syndrome
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Nick Wu", "picture"=>{"path"=>"/assets/image/me.jpg"}, "social"=>{"twitter"=>"WujunaoNick", "github"=>"NickWu007", "email"=>"mailto:wujunao19950715@gmail.com"}}
item.description: In this episode, we talk about Impostor Syndrome with a great guest. We discuss each other’s story and give some tips on dealing with Impostor Syndrome.
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone! This is a brand new podcast for you!

In this shorter episode, we talk about Impostor Syndrome with a great guest. We discuss each other’s story and give some tips on dealing with Impostor Syndrome.

Breakpoints(lol):

00:00 Intro. 03:12 Speed Round with Alex. 16:51 Main topic: Impostor Syndrome. 18:33 Zack talks about his battle with Impostor Syndrome during uni and work. 27:51 Zack talks about how to view Impostor Syndrome as a positive. 31:55 Nick talks about psychological safety, and using it to deal with Impostor Syndrome. 40:00 Getting support from others. 45:41 “Compile down to essentials”. 51:12 Pick and Plug.

———————————————————— Links in this episode:

My blog post about Impostor Syndrome: https://nickwu007.github.io/life/non_technical/2017/10/22/impostor-syndrome-thoughts-and-tips/.

Harvard CS50 online course: https://cs50.harvard.edu/2018/fall/

Contexts Mac App: https://contexts.co.

A Philosophy of Software Design: http://amzn.eu/d/iaIrjLu.

The Man in the High Castle: http://amzn.eu/d/0pq0PiH.

————————————————————

Next week we will have a new guest with a new topic! So subscribe and stay tuned!

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/WujunaoNick

item.description: In this shorter episode, I talk about my morning and night routines! Hopefully some of the tips will help you develop your own routines!
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone! This is a brand new podcast for you!

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/WujunaoNick

In this shorter episode, I talk about my morning and night routines! Hopefully some of the tips will help you develop your own routines!

Breakpoints(lol):

00:00 Intro. 01:30 Why have morning and night routines? 03:23 My morning routines. 12:12 My night routines. 18:00 “Compile down to essentials”.

———————————————————— Links in this episode:

item.description: In this episode, we have a great school mate Alex joining us to talk about First Dev Job: how we got our first job, tips on job hunting, interviews, and more!
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone! This is a brand new podcast for you!

In this episode, we have a great school mate Alex joining us to talk about First Dev Job: how we got our first job, tips on job hunting, interviews, and more!

Breakpoints(lol):

00:00 Intro. 02:12 Speed Round with Alex. 19:04 Main topic: First Dev Job. 19:26 Alex talks about his journey of getting his first job. 26:55 Nick talks about how he got his first job. 31:00 General tips on job hunting. 38:44 CV tips. 46:44Interview tips. 01:08:19 “Compile down to essentials”. 1:11:58 Pick and Plug.

———————————————————— Links in this episode:

MIT open course on Algorithm and data structure: https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/electrical-engineering-and-computer-science/6-006-introduction-to-algorithms-fall-2011/

LeetCode: https://leetcode.com

Crack the Coding Interview book: http://amzn.eu/dlkHaB0

CareerCup: https://careercup.com/

Hiring without whiteboards: https://github.com/poteto/hiring-without-whiteboards

Pink of the week: Coding Tech YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtxCXg-UvSnTKPOzLH4wJaQ ————————————————————

Next week we will have a new guest with a new topic! So subscribe and stay tuned!

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/WujunaoNick

item.title: Compile Podcast Ep 2: When to quit a project
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Nick Wu", "picture"=>{"path"=>"/assets/image/me.jpg"}, "social"=>{"twitter"=>"WujunaoNick", "github"=>"NickWu007", "email"=>"mailto:wujunao19950715@gmail.com"}}
item.description: In this episode, we have another great friend John joining us to talk about when you should quit a project: why you might want to consider quitting, how to deal with the guilt, what you can do to make the quitting easier, and more!
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone! This is a brand new podcast for you!

In this episode, we have another great friend John joining us to talk about when you should quit a project: why you might want to consider quitting, how to deal with the guilt, what you can do to make the quitting easier, and more!

Breakpoints(lol):

00:00 Intro. 00:36 Introduce guest: John. 05:07 Speed Round with John. 16:10 Main topic: When to quit a project. 17:21 John and Nick discuss a typical situation to quit a project. 19:30 John explains “Sunk Cost Fallacy”, and how to weigh different options when you are at a crossroad with your project. 24:50 Guilt of quitting a project. 31:27 How to deal with the guilt? 37:00 Quitting as part of time/energy management. 42:25 “Compile down to essentials”. 45:28 Pick and Plug.

Bare with me with the rubbish audio, not really good with editing yet. Also if you find the audio funny from time to time, that’s probably because we had a few disconnects during recording, and some of the bits are re-rendered in post.

Next week we will have a new guest with a new topic! So subscribe and stay tuned!

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/WujunaoNick
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, we have another great friend John joining us to talk about when you should quit a project: why you might want to consider quitting, how to deal with the guilt, what you can do to make the quitting easier, and more!

item.title: Compile Podcast Ep 1: Side projects
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Nick Wu", "picture"=>{"path"=>"/assets/image/me.jpg"}, "social"=>{"twitter"=>"WujunaoNick", "github"=>"NickWu007", "email"=>"mailto:wujunao19950715@gmail.com"}}
item.description: In our premier episode, we have a great guest Brennan joining us to talk about side projects.
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone! This is a brand new podcast for you!

In our premier episode, we have a great guest Brennan joining us to talk about side projects: why you might want to do a side project, how to get started, and how to deal with getting stuck, and more!

Brennan’s LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/brennanproudfoot/.

Breakpoints(lol):

00:00 Intro. 00:43 Introduce guest: Brennan. 02:47 Speed Round with Brennan. 12:24 Main topic: side projects. 12:48 Brennan and Nick talk about one of their own side projects. 19:30 Why side projects are good for you? 30:25 How to deal with loss of motivation, and getting un-stuck? 39:25 How/where to get started? 46:10 “Compile down to essentials”. 52:09 Pick and Plug.

Bare with me with the rubbish audio, not really good with editing yet. Also terrible sense of humor of my side, sorry Brennan!

Next week we will have a new guest with a new topic! So subscribe and stay tuned!

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/WujunaoNick

item.title: Compile Podcast Ep 0: The Pilot
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Nick Wu", "picture"=>{"path"=>"/assets/image/me.jpg"}, "social"=>{"twitter"=>"WujunaoNick", "github"=>"NickWu007", "email"=>"mailto:wujunao19950715@gmail.com"}}
item.description: In our pilot episode, I talk about who I am, and why I am starting this podcast.
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone! This is a brand new podcast for you!

In our pilot episode, I talk about the name of the podcast, a speed round of myself, and why I am starting this podcast! If there’s anything you want to say, be it suggestion on recording, any topic you want to hear us do, anything at all, feel free to leave a comment!

Breakpoints(lol):

00:00 Intro 00:28 Why “Compile”? 02:10 Speed Round 05:56 Why I started this podcast?

Bare with me with the rubbish audio, not really good with editing yet.

Next week we will have our first proper episode, with our first guest! So subscribe and stay tuned!

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/WujunaoNick

See you all next week!
